data.value: This section describes the available solvers that can be selected by the 'method' parameter. The default method is
uses a modification of the Powell hybrid method as implemented in MINPACK .
solves the system of nonlinear equations in a least squares sense using a modification of the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm as implemented in MINPACK .
are inexact Newton methods, with backtracking or full line searches . Each method corresponds to a particular Jacobian approximations.
uses Broyden's first Jacobian approximation, it is   known as Broyden's good method.
uses Broyden's second Jacobian approximation, it   is known as Broyden's bad method.
uses Krylov approximation for inverse Jacobian. It   is suitable for large-scale problem.
uses a tuned diagonal Jacobian   approximation.
may be useful for specific problems, but whether they will work may depend strongly on the problem.
